intro: Anacharis hilariana, commonly known as the red-leaf anacharis, is a species of aquatic plant native to South America. It is characterized by its bright red or orange leaves, which stand out in freshwater environments. The plant typically grows in slow-moving or still waters, such as ponds and lakes. Its leaves are long and narrow, often floating on the water surface or submerged. Anacharis hilariana is popular in aquariums due to its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in various water conditions.
